meanings.sent1: The rejector refused to accept the invitation to the party.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was the rejector of late homework submissions.
meanings.sent3: The rejector of vegetables found a clever way to hide them in the napkin.
meanings.sent4: She was a rejector of negativity, always focusing on the positive.
meanings.sent5: The rejector of bad ideas always kept the team on track with innovative solutions.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism that rejects something.
meanings.sent1: The rejector in the machine sorted out the defective products.
meanings.sent2: The rejector at the end of the conveyor belt separated the damaged items.
meanings.sent3: The rejector in the vending machine had a mind of its own, refusing to dispense snacks.
meanings.sent4: The rejector in the system acted like a gatekeeper, only allowing quality items to pass through.
meanings.sent5: The rejector in the printer prevented any paper jams, ensuring smooth operation.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that rejects something.
meanings.sent1: The new recruit felt like a rejector in the team, always being left out.
meanings.sent2: The rejector of outdated technology led the company towards modernization.
meanings.sent3: The cat acted as a rejector of unwanted attention, hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The rejector of unhealthy habits inspired others to make positive changes.
meanings.sent5: The rejector of fake news always verified information before sharing it.
